content: data nerd running mitts a fitted mitten with closed thumb opening for a watch face and long cuff that can cover the fingers or be folded back requirements fingering weight yarn *samples knit from leftover sock yarn scraps pattern written as all one colour but yarn can be swapped out for a new colour at any point* us 2 2 75mm dpn needles 28 sts = 4 row gauge not critical note this is sized for a women s medium abbreviations k knit p purl sts stitches pm place marker sm slip marker ssk slip two stitches as if to knit insert left needle into front of slipped stitches knit these two stitches together k2tog knit two stitches together kfb knit into front and then back of the same stitch to increase 1 instructions cast on starting from the wrist cast on 60 stitches using a stretchy cast on i used a cable cast on k2 p2 rib for 1 5 knit 5 row stockinette knit each round watch face opening section this creates the opening for the watch face at the top of the left wrist left mitten watch hand right mitten k 9 stitches cast off 12 stitches k to end work 13 row stockinette of round work in stockinette stitch back and forth for 11 row k 9 stitches cast on 12 stitches to close the opening and continue working in the round k to end of round decrease section start decreasing for the wrist to create a fitted shape 60 sts on needles left mitten right mitten set up row knit 45 stitches pm k to end set up row knit 15 stitches pm knit to of round end of round row 1 knit to 3 stitches before marker ssk k sm k k2tog k to end of round row 2-5 knit repeat row 1-5 another 5 times for a total of 12 decreased stitches 48 stitches on needles remove markers thumb gusset both mittens the same set up row k3 pm k to 3 stitches before end of round pm k2 row 1 k to 1 stitch before marker kfb sm k to marker sm kfb k to end of round row 2 knit all repeat row 1+2 again 7 times a total of 22 stitches between markers place stitches between markers on scrap yarn or a holder knit 4 rounds stockinette closing the gap at thumb tightly hand ribbing k2p2 rib for 4 5 or long enough to cover to end of fingers bind off with a stretchy bind off jenny s surprisingly stretchy bind off is recommended thumb place stitches from holder onto dpn divided to work in the round row 1 knit all stitches picking up at least one stitch at thumb gusset to help close gap knit 1 5 thumb decreases row 1 * k2tog k1 * repeat to last 2 stitches k2tog row 2 + 3 knit row 4 * k2tog k1 * repeat to end row 5 + 6
